page.title: 02HISTORY OF DALLINGTON
page.content: Dallington or Dalintune, as it was named in 1086 is bordered on the north west of Brightling and Burwash;on the east by Brightling and Penhurst and Battle;on the south by Ashburnham and Penhurst;on then north and west by Warbleton.Dallington did have 3 hop fields possitioned at Bakers lane,Steam hill and Christmas farm.It also had one oast house which is at Dean farm.And the grain store is the new garage of the white houses.The Dallington butcher was at the Old Manor and the Post Office was at the Old Post Office.The Old School is now the Village Hall.Some of the games they use to play are such things as jumping of the Sugar loaf which not a lot of people would do now days because the Sugar loaf is 10 metres in hight.
